modName: Journey ENB for RLO Realistic Lighting Overhaul
summary: Journey ENB, a realistic graphical overhaul for Skyrim made for gameplay, inspiring visuals and complete immersion.
descriptionHtml:
[FONT=Century Gothic]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/qjZgvco.jpg[/IMG]
[SIZE=6][CENTER]Journey ENB 1.0[/CENTER][/SIZE]

[SIZE=5][CENTER][B]Description[/B][/CENTER][/SIZE][SIZE=3]
ENB is a graphic enhancer made by Boris Vorontsov, the founder that made any ENB preset possible. 
All credit goes to him.
This particular preset was made with realism and playability in mind. Much time was spent optimizing both looks and performance. See screenshots or the video below to see what this mod is all about.
[/SIZE]
[CENTER][YOUTUBE]xs60DYXoJ6c[/YOUTUBE][/CENTER]

[SIZE=5][CENTER][B]Installation[/B][/CENTER][/SIZE][SIZE=3]
-Download the file provided [URL=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0119.htm ]here[/URL].
-Extract the file anywhere, and copy the \"d3d9.dll\" from the \"Wrapperversion\"-folder to your Skyrim main folder.
-Download \"Journey ENB\"
-Extract anywhere
-Copy preferred version to your Skyrim main folder
-Enjoy :-)
[/SIZE]

[SIZE=5][CENTER][B]Compability[/B][/CENTER][/SIZE][SIZE=3]
[B]ENB[/B]
This mod is made for ENBseries for Skyrim V.0.119, and if you use any other version this ENB will NOT look as intended. 
You will most likely get a too bright/dark image and wrong ratios between lights and shadows if you use any other ENB.

[B]Lighting/weather mods[/B]
This ENB was built around \"Realistic Lighting Overhaul\", so the use of any other lighting/weather mod such as \"Realistic light and FX\" or \"Climates of Tamriel\" will NOT make this mod look as intended.
[COLOR=RED]I will not be making a seperate version for any other lighting mod than[/COLOR][URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30450 ] RLO[/URL][COLOR=RED].[/COLOR]
You are of course welcomed to see if this preset works with your preferred lighting mod, and if you tweak this setting so that it works with that mod, feel free to upload that ENB as your own. Only credit me if you feel that you should.
[I]If your skyrim crashes upon start after installing RLO, dissable the Dawnguard patch[/I]

[B]Injectors[/B]
This ENB uses no injectors, and you are free to use Msaa, Fxaa, or whatever your weapon of choise is. 
Just remember that doing so might make this mod NOT look as intended.
[I]( Remember to set \"EnableProxyLibrary=true\" and add your dll-name in the \"enbseries.ini\" when using an injector)[/I]

[B]Exterior Fog Revamped[/B]
This mod will NOT look as intended with Exterior Fog Revamped
[/SIZE]

[SIZE=5][CENTER][B]A few words about performance[/SIZE][/CENTER][/B][SIZE=3]
I\'ve noticed people will ask about \"how much fps loss?\", and the question is justified but kind of missleading. 
The answer is: it depends. 
Among other things, it depends on how many surfaces you have on screen to apply shadow and SSAO/SkyLighting on. Staring on a blank wall, ENB will not affect your fps noticably. If you have ugrid 9 and alot of tree\'s, grass and actors on screen, the impact on framerate is going to be very noticable. If you experience bad framerates, try one of the medium settings. I personally think even the lowest setting looks very good. Experiment and see what you find acceptable. Some people need 60fps at all times, some are happy with around 30fps.
[/SIZE]

[SIZE=5][CENTER][B]Recommended mods ( in no particular order )[/SIZE][/CENTER][/B][SIZE=3]
[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30450 ]REALISTIC LIGHT OVERHAUL[/URL]

[SIZE=5][CENTER][B]Thanks & Credit[/SIZE][/CENTER][/B][SIZE=3]
Boris Volontsov ofcourse. the creators of all the mods above. I have given you all my endorsement. All the guys/gals at the ENBseries forum for constant inspiration. 
[/SIZE]
[/FONT]
author: majk360
